title: Dream Log Homes and Plans
features: More people are building log homes than ever before. In fact, according to the Log Home Council (LHC) of the National Association of Home Builders, sales have doubled over the last decade. "Almost 90 percent of these houses are their owners' primary home and 84 percent are built in or near metropolitan areas," says the LHC.
addresses the design needs of existing and potential log home owners and offers inspiration and advice for adding custom, personal touches.
description: "...a valuable guide to buying, designing, and building a log house is accompanied by outstanding examples of log homes and their innovative kitchens, bedrooms, bathrooms, and gathering spaces as well as maintenance tips and advice..."

More people are building log homes than ever before. In fact, according to the Log Home Council (LHC) of the National Association of Home Builders, sales have doubled over the last decade. "Almost 90 percent of these houses are their owners' primary home and 84 percent are built in or near metropolitan areas," says the LHC.

addresses the design needs of existing and potential log home owners and offers inspiration and advice for adding custom, personal touches. Topics covered include:*What's entailed in buying, designing, and building a log house*Log Home Living: Fine examples of log house and interviews of their owners, designers, builders*Gathering spaces: ideas for furnishing and decorating* Hard-working kitchens with heart: ideas for creating a kitchen that's big on warmth and functionality*Bed and Bath: capturing ambiance in an at-home getaway*Outdoor views: taking advantage of exterior spaces*Maintenance: special tips and advice*Resources: industry related associations and manufacturers*Glossary*Index

Find out what's entailed in buying, designing, and decorating a log home. Learn how to make the most out of architectural details. See what designers and decorators have done with color and furnishings in log homes from all over the country.

As a writer and designer Barbara Winfield's career has spanned many areas of the home furnishings industry. Former editor of Woman’s Day Home Remodeling Magazine, Ms. Winfield is a recipient of the Dallas Market Center Editorial Award. In addition to working as a freelance writer and interior design coach, she is also an accomplished seminar leader and has taught several design courses in the Interior Design Department of the Fashion Institute of Technology in NYC. Her book,
The Complete Book of Home Details
was published by Crescent Books in 1994.
